* *Strong problem-solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills, and the ability to learn and adapt quickly.*
* *Leading skills, such as leading teams, planning, organizing, and reporting.*

title: Graduate Consultants for Cloud First at Accenture Technology
description:
*Are you ready to put your skills and abilities into practice? Come join Accenture in Stockholm, Malmö or Gothenburg in February 2025 and let us help you create the perfect foundation for a career within Technology consulting!*
 Tech Talent Program
   

  

 When entering Accenture Technology as a graduate consultant, you will be part of our Tech Talent Program.
   

  

  

- During the two-year Tech Talent Program, you will go through an intense learning process – with a Buddy and People Lead helping and coaching you to figure out exactly how to develop your career and skills needed to succeed.

- You will be a consultant from day one as you will be part of projects where we implement complex technology and business critical IT systems for our international clients, transforming their business.

- You will build your professional network across the organization by being part of projects, taking part in our communities and by joining our social events and parties.

 Accenture Technology Accenture Technology leverages design thinking, industry insights and the latest digital and security methodologies to help clients innovate, grow, and improve their businesses. Our expertise, capabilities and experience mean that our clients (including some of the biggest brands in the world) trust us to find the right solutions for their needs. Cloud First Accenture continues to lead in the cloud and today has a broad footprint among all the major cloud providers as well as private clouds and on-premise infrastructure. Digital and cloud technologies are changing the way our clients do business and are transforming the operating models and infrastructure at the heart of their operations. We have a clear market differentiation and leadership in New Emerging & Growth Technologies like Extended Reality, Blockchain, Application Security and leveraging our Innovation Architecture that will reflect the essence of the New Engineered Software Technologies
 **About the role**
 Whether you are a programmer guru, a digital innovator, a tech wizard, or a business problem solver, you will find an exciting career path on the cutting edge. We would love to get to know your unique blend of talents and help you explore and grow them further
   

  

*These are some of the responsibilities and tasks that you as a graduate may work with:*
- Help our customers to develop the best IT solutions by being a link between business and IT

- Work with cloud solutions like Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Cloud Platform, Azure and Amazon Web Services

- Support in identifying customer requirements, seek client clarifications, understand compliance and apply modern cloud functionality to meet the requirements

- Work and develop solutions using program languages like Java, Python, SQL and more

- Design and build security in IT environments and cloud platforms

- Support in developing relevant solutions and requirements fitting well to our Journey to the Cloud strategy (J2C)

- Support in Change Management, help clients make best usage of the Accenture assets and best practices across the clouds

- Support project management or other management functions in projects

- Grow your professional skills within analytics, artificial intelligence, Big Data and machine learning

**Who are you?**
- You will soon receive your bachelor’s or master's degree within relevant area

- You want to join our Stockholm office in February 2025

- You have excellent written and oral presentation skills in both English and Swedish

- You are ambitious, driven, solution-oriented and motivated to start your career in a technology consulting role

**Application**
 Send your application and attach:
   

  

  

- CV

- Cover Letter

- University transcripts/grades

 Upload all files under "Upload Resume/CV". Please note that all these documents are required for a complete application.
 **Only complete applications are reviewed.** 
 Due to the summer holiday season, our response times might be a bit longer than usual. Please note that we will review your application in August and get back to you shortly after. Thank you for your interest in Accenture! If your application proceeds to the next step, you will receive an invitation to two tests that aim to measure your analytical ability as well as a personality form.
   

  

**By joining Accenture, you get**
- An end-to-end focus with clients as a trusted partner and advisor to support them from strategy to execution

- Access to a global network of experts and personal co-operation with senior high-performing colleagues and market leading clients

- A career counselor/mentor who helps you define career goals and supports you in achieving your goals and your full potential

- Personal training opportunities and a market leading career-development program. Excellent possibilities for learning and knowledge gain, resulting in a great possibility to grow as both a person and a professional.

- A very strong team culture among supportive colleagues, where team spirit and cooperation are highly valued and rewarded

- Extensive wellbeing program, that boosts your overall wellbeing, energy, and ability to work in a sustainable way.

- Opportunities to get involved in corporate citizenship initiatives, from volunteering to doing charity work, as well as Inclusion & Diversity networks.

 We look forward to receiving your application! Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from diverse backgrounds related to gender, ethnicity, culture, age etc. We provide an environment of inclusion and diversity where everyone brings distinct experience, talent, and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity!
   

  

**What you also get** 
**:** 
 Accenture IF
   

  

 Accenture IF is a community hosted by our colleagues – for our colleagues, to meet and practice sports and physical activities. We offer a wide range of activities like football, racket sports, running, sailing, golf, yoga and much more.
   

  

 To exercise sports, you enjoy in the company of others, will help you stay motivated and healthy. Join our yearly events such as a cross-country skiing bootcamp, Accenture European Championship in football or an upcoming hiking trip in the mountains. We strongly believe in work-life balance and to have fun together! Parental leave
   

  

 We want our employees to grow and achieve value in life, both in their profession and in their personal life. Accenture offer a market leading compensation for parental leave – we pay for 270 days and compensate 90% of the difference between Social Insurance Agency’s (Försäkringskassan) maximum coverage and a base pay up to 80 000 SEK/month. Sick leave/Well-being
   

  

 In need of medical treatment, we want our employees to get well supported. All Accenture employees are covered by a health insurance by Skandia - Skandia Lifeline Access. The insurance offers healthcare of physical and mental treatments, including rehabilitation. During sick leave you will get well covered, Accenture pay 80% of your salary day 2-14 and 90% day 15-90. Our “Truly Human” network aim to bring us all together – as truly human individuals. We commit to care for ourselves and others, to foster an open-minded and supporting environment. Together we can help each other to achieve our aspirations and become the best version of ourselves. One of many initiatives are “Truly Human Health Academy”, a 100-day journey filled with classes held by health- and dietician experts, workshops, and buddy challenges – to learn and reflect on well-being and daily habits. Networks
   

  

 At Accenture we offer network opportunities, for our employees to meet and share common interests. Our aim is to foster a company culture that stands for inclusion and diversity – a place for everyone in terms of cross-cultural diversity, ethnicity, gender, disability, mental health, and LGBTQI.
   

  

 Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
   

  

 All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.
   

  

 Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.

title: HRIS (Workday) Specialist
description:
**Workday Specialist** 




*Stockholm, Sweden (hybrid working)* 




*Permanent job - 60,000-75,000 SEK per month* 




  





 We are working with a software company in the heart of Stockholm, to help grow their team to keep up with the demand for their product! Do you love streamlining HR business processes and have a knack for technology? This could be the role for you.
 



  





 In this role, you'll be a key player in optimizing HR and financial operations through Workday. You'll work closely with internal stakeholders to understand their needs, configure the platform accordingly, and ensure smooth system adoption - acting as the bridge between technology and HR.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Analyse business requirements and translate them into actionable Workday configurations
* Configure, test, and maintain various Workday modules (specific modules to be listed based on company needs)
* Develop and maintain user guides and training materials
* Provide ongoing support to end-users, troubleshoot issues, and resolve escalations
* Stay up-to-date on Workday best practices and emerging functionalities



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Minimum 2 years of experience working with Workday and relevant modules
* Strong understanding of HR processes
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize tasks effectively
* Strong communication and collaboration skills



  





**Benefits:** 



* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Opportunity to work with an end client directly, where you can grow and develop long-term.
* Be part of a strong Workday division, where you can be mentored and also provide your valuable input.
* Budget allocation for your certifications/training



  





*How to Apply:* 




 Ready to take on this exciting challenge? Apply now with your CV.
 



  





*Empiric is not just a recruitment agency; we are a dynamic force in technology and transformation. Specializing in data, digital, cloud, and commercial sales, we pride ourselves on creating an environment where talent thrives and innovation flourishes.*

title: Business Controller EMEA
description:
Sinch is a Customer Communication Cloud company, directly powering meaningful conversations at scale across messaging, voice and email to help businesses deliver unified, personalized experiences that truly revolve around their customers - no matter the channels they use. More than 150,000 businesses - including many of the world's largest tech companies, rely on us for their customer communication needs.
   

  

 We dream big - for our company, our customers and our employees - and we hire the best talent worldwide to help us bring our vision to life. We have near 4,500 Sinchers in more than 60 countries - probably somewhere near you!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Business Controller EMEA, you will support and challenge managers and their organizations to achieve financial goals, offer strategic insights and lead reporting and budgeting process. You will support Revenue growth, OPEX control and cost optimization through proactive business follow-up.
   

  

 This role is based at our HQ in Stockholm, Sweden but we are open to other major Sinch European locations as well. The role reports to VP, EMEA FP&A.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Partner with Regional senior leadership to drive achievement of financial and operational targets
* Drive P&L development for the Enterprise or Mid-Market Sales organization
* Provide insight and recommendations to strategic decision making; including but not limited to profitability/ROI analysis, business plan review, cost optimization
* Setup frameworks from a finance perspective to enable commercial success; including but not limited to Sales KPI steering and cost allocation models
* Drive process towards creating a full regional P&L including allocated cost
* Build and manage Regional Business reporting packages, including but not limited to P&L, BS and CF-reporting. Measure, report and challenge business performance.
* In accordance with process guidance from Corporate Control lead budgeting, forecasting and long-range planning processes for the Functions
* Interface with central Financial Operations to ensure accurate and timely reporting
* Support Sinch-wide Finance harmonization initiatives (e.g. ERP implementation)


**About You**
 To be successful in the role you have visionary and strategic mindset yet with strong hands-on ability, willingness to deep dive into details when required. You are a strong communicator that is clear, concise, engaging and persuasive across stakeholder groups, adapting the content & language to the audience. You have a commercial and business focused approach and are able to structure and process qualitative or quantitative data and draw conclusions. Last but not least, you love Excel and is fierce at PowerPoint and have the ability to simplify complex data.
   

  

* Proven experience of Business Controlling or equivalent in a large and international company
* Experience of Accounting or Financial control
* Proven experience from driving financial process transformation and process excellence
* Experience in setting up frameworks for commercial enablement (customer pricing, product costing, market research, etc) and supporting contract negotiations etc.
* Experience in the following systems is a plus: Aaro, Tableau, Salesforce, SAP by Design, Great Plains, Netsuite
* Fluency in English is required


**Our Values**
 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple" and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation for fostering an environment where diversity of thinking, skills and experiences are embraced, delivering innovation and better business results.
   

  

**Bring your authentic self to Sinch**
 Here at Sinch we embrace diversity and work to create an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. No matter who you are, you'll be able to explore new career and growth options - sharing your voice, building your path and making it happen with us.
   

  

 We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will be considered to join our team regardless of race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
   

  

**Our Hiring Process**
 At Sinch, we are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and non-discriminatory. We use pre-employment assessment to create an inclusive application experience to help foster diverse and high performing teams.
   

  

 Even if you do not meet all job requirements, don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always looking for people that could help us pioneer the way the world communicates.
   

  

 If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open roles on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/

title: Support Quality Associate
description:
**Job Requisition ID #**
 24WD79477
   

  

**Position Overview**
 We are looking for an accountable, impactful, and innovative Support Quality Associate (SQA) to expand our world-renowned Customer Support Team. As an SQA, reporting to the Quality Manager, you will help pioneer what quality assurance and feedback delivery means for our team so that we can improve the service we provide to customers and the learning experiences for our employees in their careers. You will also support our customers throughout their daily operations with passion, experience empathizing with frustrated customers, and a craving for feedback. This is an exciting time at Autodesk and you will lead from the front - you will affect our employees' and customers' experiences every day, in several industries, all over the world. This job can be hybrid or remote (dependent on your current location).
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* ~50% of time spent driving Quality Assurance (QA) results (via MaestroQA)
+ Identify and deliver trend analysis data to drive Enablement and Documentation effectiveness; help create or cater boot camps and other training programs
+ Grade cases (chats, emails, and phone calls), address grade appeals, and deliver feedback to EBCS Support employees
+ Oversee and maintain our grading rubric to adapt to changing business needs and goals
+ Lead regular calibration sessions to ensure grading cohesion, areas of improvement are identified and acted upon, and provide coaching opportunities
+ Own, develop, and maintain reports based on grades, CSAT, and other goals

* ~50% of time supporting customers and internal users who use EBCS in different platforms. Our channels of communication are live chat, email, and phone.
+ Interactions include but are not limited to: troubleshooting technical issues, product usage questions, onboarding and set up, subscription inquiries, and carrying customer's voice to internal teams to drive the business forward
+ Perform  investigations into technical issues, and log cases with accurate information to provide a full record of each issue and resolution. Ensure every interaction is of the highest quality
+ Communicate daily with the Technical Team, SOPX, and Leadership to report support issues, bugs, important
+ user concerns, customer sentiment, and product feedback


**Minimum Qualifications**
* Hit goal in KPIs (the Whats) and behaviors (the Hows) in your current role (impactful, accountable, courageous, and integrity)
* Data-driven; you're comfortable creating & analyzing reports, telling a story with the data, and delivering action-items to partners
* Experience handling support requests from a variety of different channels, while handling emails, supporting your peers, and always learning new things
* Use Autodesk procedure to guide interactions with customers; are transparent and honest
* Are comfortable navigating a CRM
* Understand the basic functionality of Apple iOS, Android, and Windows platforms as well as cloud-based software like Microsoft Suite, OneDrive, etc
* Previous experience troubleshooting and supporting iOS, Android, and Windows platforms
* Experience with chat systems
* Familiarity with the construction industry


**Learn More**
**About Autodesk**
 Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.
   

  

 We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – our Culture Code is at the core of everything we do. Our values and ways of working help our people thrive and realize their potential, which leads to even better outcomes for our customers.
   

  

 When you’re an Autodesker, you can be your whole, authentic self and do meaningful work that helps build a better future for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!
   

  

**Benefits**
 From health and financial benefits to time away and everyday wellness, we give Autodeskers the best, so they can do their best work. Learn more about our benefits in the U.S. by visiting https://benefits.autodesk.com/
   

  

**Salary transparency**
 Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive compensation package. For U.S.-based roles, we expect a starting base salary between $53,300 and $91,850. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience and geographic location, and may exceed this range. In addition to base salaries, we also have a significant emphasis on annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.
   

  

**Equal Employment Opportunity**
 At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.
   

  

**Diversity & Belonging**
 We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging and an equitable workplace where everyone can thrive. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging
   

  

**Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk?**
 Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site).

title: Quality Engineering Manager
description:
**Location** 
 : Fully remote, Asia Time Zone
   

  

**Start date** 
 : ASAP
   

  

**Languages** 
 : English is mandatory; French is a plus
   

  

**Our client** 
 : Cloud Computing / Blockchain / AI - European SaaS
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Lead and manage a team of Senior Automation Engineers and Manual Testers.
* Set clear objectives and performance metrics for the QA team and collaborate with Dev Managers to define quality expectations across departments.
* Champion continuous improvement of the QA Sign-Off process, ensuring high-quality releases.
* Drive improvements in test coverage at all levels: unit, component, API, and E2E, with a strong focus on test automation.
* Foster unit test ownership within development teams.
* Collaborate with Dev Managers to define and implement effective testing strategies.
* Implement and optimize non-functional testing practices within the company's test strategy.
* Lead the adoption of AI and innovative testing solutions.
* Leverage your strong technical skills to develop and maintain automated test frameworks using Python, Selenium, and RestAssured.
* Utilize Postman to generate tests from Swagger specifications.
* Manage and maintain test cases and automation scripts within XRay.
* Utilize CI/CD pipelines, with a focus on Github Actions (experience with Jenkins a plus).
* Possess a basic understanding of Android (Kotlin + Jetpack Compose and E2E test with Maestro) and iOS (Swift + SwiftUI, E2E tests: XCTest).
* Understand peer-to-peer architectures and cloud-based applications.
* Champion the use of data-driven insights for continuous improvement through effective management of metrics dashboards in Jira and XRay.
* Foster a culture of innovation and continuous learning within the QA team.


**Required qualifications:**
* Minimum 7-8 years of experience in a Quality Engineering leadership role.
* Proven track record of building and leading high-performing QA teams.
* Strong technical skills in programming languages like Python, scripting languages like Shell, and familiarity with cloud platforms is a plus.
* Extensive experience with test automation frameworks like Selenium and RestAssured.
* Expertise in API testing and experience with tools like Postman and Swagger.
* In-depth knowledge of XRay test management tool.
* Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines (Github Actions preferred, Jenkins experience a plus).
* Basic understanding of mobile development frameworks (Android: Kotlin + Jetpack Compose and E2E test with Maestro; iOS: Swift + SwiftUI, E2E tests: XCTest).
* Understanding of peer-to-peer architectures and experience with cloud applications.
* Excellent communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Passion for quality and a desire to continuously improve processes.

title: Senior Engineering Manager - Stockholm
description:
**Join the planet’s most important fight!**
****Normative is looking for a Senior Engineering Manager in Stockholm!****
 At Normative, we're on a mission to accelerate the transition to a net-zero world. We provide science-based carbon accounting software and tailored advice from net-zero experts, empowering companies to reduce their carbon footprints.
   

  

 Our R&D team is now looking to hire an experienced Engineering Manager with strong technical expertise to continue our journey towards becoming an efficient and impactful R&D organization with high engagement and motivation.
   

  

 As a leader in our Engineering organisation, you will make a real impact on the fight against climate change and play a crucial role in helping companies achieve their NetZero goals and contribute to a sustainable future.
   

  

**How You Will Make An Impact**
 As an Engineering Manager at Normative, you are an integral part of the team's leadership and ultimately responsible for the team reaching its goals. You will lead a team of talented engineers, ensuring exceptional delivery on our carbon accounting products as well as a healthy technical platform. You will be in close partnership with the product manager and the product designer to align the team’s effort with the company's strategic goals, driving continuous improvement and operational excellence.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Advocate and advance effective software development practices and help the team develop well architected and high quality code.
* Empower the team to focus on the right problems, and in close collaboration with the product manager pave the way for the team hitting its goals.
* Form the product roadmap together with product management and design and ensure initiatives are feasible and technically sound. Highlight product opportunities from a technical perspective.
* Work with and contribute to the engineering management group and R&D leadership on our processes, initiatives and long-term goals to accelerate our product development and ultimately positive impact on the climate.
* Develop engineers through coaching and mentoring; by conducting regular 1:1s, setting goals and feedback conversations to support them in their growth as engineers.
* Make sure that there is a high level of teamwork, transparency, and efficiency in the team and in collaboration with other teams.
* Continuously work to improve inclusion and belonging in your team and within our organization.


**What You Bring**
* Experience leading cross functional software engineering teams in a fast paced, delivery focused environment. Preferably from a SaaS environment.
* Strong technical background with significant practical experience in software development - ideally across the full stack, and bonus if has experience with design system.
* Hands on leadership, communication and team-building skills.
* The ability to grow and engage engineering teams through the day to day work.
* Strong product and business mindset, coupled with a get-things-done attitude.


**Technology setup**
* We aim to use a consistent set of technologies across the teams where this is feasible. We would rather do a great job once than a mediocre job multiple times over.
* Our primary technology stack is Typescript using NodeJS on the backend services. We are finalizing our migration to PostgreSQL from MongoDB.
* Our frontend is built on Svelte with a few legacy areas built Angular. These are getting migrated to Svelte as we develop each area further.
* For our carbon calculation services as well as artificial intelligence we primarily use Python and related technologies.
* We are hosted in AWS and are in the final stages of consolidating our hosting and deployment setup.


 If you are a driven and passionate individual with a strong desire to make a positive impact on the world, and a real love for Engineering, we encourage you to apply. This is an exciting opportunity to join a mission-driven company and make a real difference in the fight against climate change.
   

  

 Join us and be a part of something bigger than yourself. Together, we can create a more sustainable future for all.
   

  

**Location**
 Normative operates on a hybrid remote model with offices in Stockholm, Copenhagen, and London. For this role you will be located in our wonderful HQ in Stockholm to stay close to the teams as well as the wider leadership group with R&D.
   

  

*At this time we are not able to offer relocation or VISA support for this position.*
**Benefits**
* Market-based salaries and annual merit-based salary reviews
* 30 days/year of paid vacation + up to 2 additional days off
* Pension and parental leave
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag) + 1 wellness hour per week
* Social and team-building activities (off-site, after work, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact on the world
* A friendly, supportive and humble working culture


*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.*
**How To Apply**
 We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.
   

  

 Our interview process consists of 4 stages:
   

  

* Screening interview with a member of our Talent Acquisition team
* First interview with the hiring manager


*Online Personality & Logic assessment*
* Interview with members of the Engineering team
* Practical Case Interview


 We’re committed to hiring diversely. Having employees from diverse backgrounds brings a wealth of perspectives and experience to our team. We assess candidates based on their experience, skills and unique talents and evaluate everyone against the same criteria.
   

  

*Normative handles sensitive financial data and we will therefore conduct a background check before hiring any candidate.*

title: IT Service Manager - Scania Battery Production
description:
Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions. IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success depends on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements.
   

  

 In the next few years, we see exciting transformational projects driven by new business models and Industry 4.0. We are also implementing a new ERP system to modernize our system landscape and support growing business demands. This will dramatically change how we conduct business, and we need a new valued team member to help us on this digitalization journey.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As a service manager for Battery Production, a cornerstone in Scania's eMobility program, you will be pivotal in capturing new ideas and requirements and, together with the rest of the team, realizing and delivering solutions.
   

  

 You will work closely with our development teams, both in-house and offshore, to coordinate development according to agile methodology. You will collaborate with scrum masters and RTEs.
   

  

 As a service manager, you will be part of strategy and development planning and have internal responsibilities in OKR work.
   

  

 You will participate in various projects, activities, and maintenance, working with different teams on diverse tasks while always keeping the customer in mind.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Work primarily with the battery production unit, ensuring processes to and from production are secure.
* Collaborate closely with business stakeholders and IT stakeholders, including project managers, business analysts, line managers, product owners, and resources in other Scania IT departments.
* Maintain a collaborative mindset to ensure business needs, architectural perspectives, and standards are fully considered and secured in the IT solution at the battery factory.


**Desired Qualifications**
* Education within IT at a university level
* 2-5 years of work experience within IT
* Strong cooperation skills
* Good understanding of development
* Strong methodology and structure skills
* Excellent communication and presentation skills in English


 Experience with ERP, MES, and SCADA systems and knowledge of Industry 4.0 is a plus. Swedish language skills are also a plus.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* To thrive in this position, we believe you are a curious and structured individual with an interest in various technologies and stay up-to-date with different techniques and methodologies.
* We value personal characteristics and encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all the requirements for the job.
* You have a positive mindset and enjoy networking and collaboration rather than working alone.
* You value presence in the factory or office and find energy in meeting other people.


**What We Offer**
 Scania is on a journey with a strong purpose: to drive the shift towards a sustainable transport system. To get there, we have gathered a diverse team with talented and fun colleagues, endless development opportunities and good work-life balance. We work a mix of remote and in office. Our offices are activity based with a lot of creative spaces in Södertälje, and we also have a new office hub close to the central station in Stockholm. Furthermore, you are offered annual bonus, lunch to reduced prices, wellness contribution and much more.
   

  

 For questions about the job, reach out to hiring manager Rikard Weinstock, rikard.weinstock@scania.com
   

  

 A background check might be conducted on the final candidate.

title: SaaS Consulting Sales Executive
description:
***This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.***
 Do you want to take ownership of your sales success? Are you a Client Solution Executive with a curiosity about helping businesses craft and transform their future in the digital world? If you’re eager to grow your sales skills in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, this is your opportunity to advance your career with a tech leader.
   

  

 Oracle’s cloud technology is changing how the world does business, and we’re looking for a Client Solution Executive to drive success on our Consulting Sales team in
 **Sweden** 
 . We have phenomenal career opportunities for every experience level and celebrate a culture of support and learning. Create the future with us!
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 You will expand opportunities within existing accounts and develop opportunities in new accounts. You will drive the entire sales cycle, including the ability:
   

  

* Develop and maintain strong business relationships with key decision-makers in your territory.
* Define sales & lead generation strategies for your territory.
* Prospect to generate leads in new accounts within your territory.
* Work with the software, cloud, and sales colleagues to identify common opportunities. You will also consult with customers to optimize existing technology opportunities and expand the solution footprint in current accounts.
* Work with the Technology and Systems teams to identify, qualify, and develop each business opportunity, agreeing on a sales strategy and a close plan.


**What We Are Looking For**
* Swedish and English speaker
* Extensive experience in selling implementation services
* Good local market knowledge


**What We Will Offer You**
* A competitive salary with exciting benefits
* Learning and development opportunities to advance your career
* An Employee Assistance Program to support your mental health
* Employee resource groups that champion our diverse communities
* An inclusive culture that celebrates what makes you unique


 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
   

  

 We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
   

  

* Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

title: Operation Engineer Talent Program
description:
Are you passionate about cloud technology and infrastructure? Do you have a knack for troubleshooting and a desire to help customers optimize their Cloud and Kubernetes environments? If so, Redeploy Run has the perfect opportunity for you who are looking to kick-start your career!
   

  

**✍** 
**About the Operation Engineer Talent Program**
 Our Operation Engineer Talent Program is designed to give you hands-on experience and in-depth knowledge of Cloud and Kubernetes environments. You will work alongside experienced professionals, learning the ins and outs of maintaining and optimizing cloud and Kubernetes platforms.
   

  

 In this role you will get the opportunity to learn how to:
   

  

* Proactively maintain and optimize Cloud and Kubernetes platforms
* Troubleshoot live issues
* Support customers in modernizing and improving their environments


**💫** 
**What you will gain**
* Possibility of a permanent position after completing the program
* Receive training and mentorship from experienced professionals
* Practical experience in managing and optimizing cloud and Kubernetes environments
* Be a part of the Redeploy team and culture. A friendly, humble and driven atmosphere


**🎯** 
**Who are you?**
* Enrolling in their LIA internship this fall, or recently completed a relevant educational program (such as ICT Engineer, Cloud and Infrastructure Specialist or similar)
* A person with a strong interest in cloud technology and infrastructure. It´s a plus if you already have some hands-on experience
* A person with strong problem-solving skills, able to tackle complex issues effectively and who is curious, humble and eager to learn and take responsibility for your own development.


 📍
 **Location**
 We have offices located in central Stockholm and Jönköping. As we encourage a mix of in-person and remote work to foster innovation and support work-life balance (and like to have fun together), we see that you are based in commuting distance to either of our office locations.
   

  

**📩** 
**Ready to apply?**
 We hope that we have sparked your interest and that you are curious to know more about the role and us at Redeploy.
   

  

 We are constantly recruiting, so submit your application as soon as you can by hitting the apply button. For any specific questions about the position, reach out to Talent Acquisition Manager Francisca Andersson – Francisca.andersson@redeploy.com
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

****🏃** 
 About Redeploy Run**
 At Redeploy Run, we specialize in platform engineering and operations, helping our customers simplify their infrastructure and speed up application delivery. Our mission is to make cloud adoption faster and easier.
   

  

 Our 'Ready-to-Run' platform products, including Technology Platforms and Industry Cloud Platforms, let IT departments and developers manage infrastructure and governance with ease. Leveraging Infrastructure as Code, container-based services, CI/CD, and Kubernetes, and collaborating with cloud providers like Azure and AWS, we tackle complex problems, enhance our tools, and provide guidance to help customers get the most out of their cloud platforms.
   

  

**For more information or questions please contact us at** 
 Francisca.andersson@redeploy.com

title: Accenture Winter Internship 2024
description:
**Join us and do extraordinary things** 
*Are you a tech-savvy, soon to be bachelor or master graduate with a passion for IT? Do you want to pursue an IT driven consulting career?* 
 Accenture’s Winter Internship gives you the opportunity to kick-start an IT consulting career. As an intern at Accenture, we will match you to either our Technology or Song practices. For
 **6 weeks starting in November** 
**(4** 
**th** 
**of November – 13** 
**th** 
**of December)** 
 you will join a real project, working together with the best people in the industry, at the forefront of digitizing customers’ everyday work. You will be part of the day-to-day work of an Accenture consultant team, bringing new innovative IT solutions to our clients and helping our clients become high performance businesses. At Accenture we work to break the traditional constraints on systems and practices with new agile ways of working and innovating. You will have the opportunity to learn about our focus in supporting our clients with technology innovation, in areas such as mobility, virtualization, artificial intelligence and automation.
 **Job Description:**
 The internship program begins with an introduction to Accenture and the way we run our business. Then, you enroll directly on a project as a full-fledged member of the Accenture team. Your responsibilities will be equivalent to those of our newly graduated employees.
 *Your tasks may include:*
- Understanding and translating of customers’ needs into a solution through the process of requirements gathering.

- Developing and be a part of creating great customer experiences across the full stack.

- Creating tools and participating in system, integration, security, or performance tests.

- Understanding the challenges and risks that exist and developing strategies and solutions to strengthen organizations' information security in the long term.

- Learning and working with cloud-based or on-premise ERP platforms from our partner corporations like SAP®, Oracle®, Microsoft® or Salesforce®.

- Preparing and delivering training for end-users.

- Conducting research, writing pre-study reports or analyzing data.

- Implementing agile practices to enable continuous improvements and to create a high performing, cost effective delivery.

- Conducting workshops and interviews.

- Gaining practical experience by developing GenAI skills and applying your knowledge to create solutions that address client use cases.

 Please specify in your application if you are interested in any of the specific areas mentioned above.
 **Location** 
 The internship is located on site in
 **Stockholm** 
**, Göteborg and Malmö** 
 but will be adjusted based on the client specific guidelines and may therefore be virtual. During the internship program we will also focus a great deal on teambuilding and social activities where you will get the chance to network with your fellow Internship participants along with regular Accenture consultants. You will be paid a salary and can utilize benefits such as free sports events with Accenture IF. After finishing the internship you will have an opportunity to work part-time as a school ambassador.
   

  

 If your university offers credits for internships, you can use this internship as a part of your education. Please let us know in your application if this would be of interest to you.
   

  

**Who are you?** 
 We are mainly looking for students within IT and engineering programs. You do not need to have previous hands-on system or programming knowledge. The most important is a passion for working with IT and software technology as well as an aptitude for consulting. We will offer both technical and functional roles related to innovation and IT. We are looking for high-performing, accountable individuals with a strong sense of job ownership and that thrive to solve unforeseen challenges in the smartest possible way.
   

  

  

- After the finished internship, you should have approximately half a year left of your studies for a bachelor's or master's degree.

- Fluency in both Swedish and English is required both verbally and in writing.

**Application:**
 The application period for Accenture Winter Internship 2024 lasts until
 **August 11th 2024.** 
 First selection will start after last application date.
 *Please attach:* 
 - CV - Cover letter (include preferred office, Stockholm/Göteborg/Malmö) - Latest university grades/transcripts.
 *Upload* 
 all
 *files under "Upload Resume/CV"* 
 . Please clarify in the cover letter which office(s) (Stockholm/Göteborg/Malmö) you would be able to work from.
 **Only complete applications are reviewed.** 
 Please note that we are unable to accept applications via e-mail. For questions regarding the internship, please contact:
 *Recruiter* 
 : agnes.blom.bringlov@accenture.com Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from diverse backgrounds related to gender, age, ethnicity, culture, race, religion and belief, disability, nationality, sexual orientation and gender identity. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values, providing an environment where everyone brings distinct experience, talent and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity.

title: Lösningsarkitekt Pris & Sortiment
description:
**I denna rekrytering samarbetar Axfood med Active Search. Du ansöker via denna länk: LÄNK TILL ANSÖKAN och mer information kontakta Rekryteringskonsult Mia Wretborn Hedberg på 070 - 727 35 00 eller via mail mia@active-search.se.**
 Som en av dagligvarubranschens största aktörer gör vi inom Axfood stor skillnad i miljontals människors liv – varje dag. Tillsammans vill vi skapa mer livskvalitet för alla vi berör genom våra olika koncept, verksamheter och varumärken. Vi tror på ständig förbättring och utveckling, och på att visa omtanke till omvärlden medan vi förändras. Var med på en resa i en spännande bransch där nytänkande, engagemang och prisvärd, bra och hållbar mat är viktiga ingredienser. Välkommen till Axfoodfamiljen!
   

  

 Axfood har en av matbranschens största IT-avdelningar med drygt 300 medarbetare. Vi ligger i framkant vad gäller digital utveckling och ny teknik inom områden som det digitala kundmötet, e-handel och arbetssätt.
   

  

**Är du den vi söker?**
 Det är en spännande roll och du kommer vara en nyckelspelare i Axfoods framtida satsningar.
   

  

 Vi tror att du arbetat mer än 5 år i olika IT-roller och har din bakgrund antingen som applikationsutvecklare som utvecklats till ett större lösningsansvar, eller så har du arbetat som affärsanalytiker/kravanalytiker och designat mer och mer IT-lösningar.
   

  

 I din roll kommer du arbeta brett, både med att föra en dialog kring djupa tekniska sammanhang, såväl som att förstå affärsprocesser och vad som driver värde hos Axfood. Ett stort plus är om du har erfarenhet från detaljhandel och gärna inom dagligvaror.
   

  

 Du kommer att få ett stort ansvar att både bibehålla och utveckla våra befintliga lösningar och kommunicera arkitekturella principer som fungerar bra, men du ska även vara med att skapa nya lösningar som stödjer vår affär.
   

  

 Bland de centrala systemen ligger tyngdpunkten på SAP-produkter såsom ECC, EWM och F&R. Vi har även implementerat plattformen CAR och där pågår projekt för att implementera fler applikationer
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Analysera och designa övergripande processer och systemflöden ner till detaljerade specifikationer för vissa utvecklingsområden.
* Delta i spännande vidareutvecklings- och nyutvecklingsuppdrag samt projekt.
* Driva och ansvara för analys, design och framtagande av lösningsförslag.
* Vidareutveckla övergripande arkitekturprinciper.
* Arbeta med framåtskridande projekt och vara med i innovativa projekt.
* Delta i arbete med att ta fram affärsplaner
* Coacha och stötta kollegor


 Följande kompetens och erfarenhet önskas
   

  

* Systemvetare eller liknande utbildning
* SAP-kompetens inom MM och SD
* Erfarenhet inom SAP Retail
* Erfarenhet från support och/eller systemförvaltning
* Erfarenhet från arbete i projektform
* God kunskap om integrationer
* God förståelse för molntjänster och integration mot dessa
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* Erfarenhet inom agila utvecklingsmetoder
* Erfarenhet inom detaljhandel och speciellt inom dagligvaror


**Erfarenhet och kunskaper**
 Som person behöver du vara initiativrik, inlyssnande och drivande i ditt arbete. I denna roll är det viktigt att du är öppen och tydlig i din kommunikation samt har lätt för att samarbeta och samverka med andra. Du trivs även med att arbeta på ett välstrukturerat och noggrant sätt samtidigt flexibel när det behövs. För att trivas i rollen är din analytiska förmåga av en central betydelse och för att lyckas i rollen är det viktigt att skapa förtroende i organisationen.
   

  

 Axfood IT Utveckling Pris & Sortiment är en avdelning inom Axfood IT som ansvarar för huvudprocess Pris & Sortiment som omfattar artikel, sortiment, kund, site, leverantör, pris & kampanj. Vi är 18 personer med roller och ansvar som Utvecklingsledare, Kanbanmaster, Applikationsspecialist, Testledare, Lösningsarkitekt och Systemansvariga. Inom Pris & Sortiment är flerparten av systemen SAP-produkter, men andra systemleverantörer förekommer också, t ex inom områdena space/varuplacering, egna märkesvaror, design, produktutveckling & underhåll, operativa & strategiska inköp, avtal med flera.
   

  

**Varför du kommer att gilla oss**
 Hos oss finns trygghet och stora utvecklingsmöjligheter. Våra medarbetares olika kunskaper, kompetenser och perspektiv skapar nya möjligheter och genererar bättre beslut. Vi uppmuntrar därför en mångfald av sökande till alla våra tjänster. Genom att erbjuda en arbetsplats som speglar det samhälle vi lever i vill vi skapa ett öppet klimat där alla våra medarbetare har möjlighet att utvecklas. Att vi växer och utvecklas tillsammans gör att vi kan leda vägen och utmana en hel bransch. Välkommen till en familj av möjligheter!
   

  

***Mångfald***
 Vi har branschens tuffaste mål för mångfald. För oss är mångfald en affärsmöjlighet. Medarbetarnas breda kunskaper kring olika språk, högtider och mat hjälper oss att spetsa vårt kunderbjudande. Vi har kommit långt men vi vill bli ännu bättre och välkomnar en mångfald av sökande till alla våra tjänster.
   

  

**Om Axfood**
 Axfood grundades år 2000. Koncernen består av en familj av varumärken och är unik i sitt slag på den svenska marknaden. Inom Axfood tror vi på allas rätt till prisvärd, bra och hållbar mat. Här ingår butikskedjorna Willys och Hemköp, liksom Tempo och Handlar’n. Grossistförsäljning sker genom Snabbgross och Dagab ansvarar för koncernens produktutveckling, inköp och logistik. I Axfood ingår även Middagsfrid och Urban Deli samt delägda Apohem, Eurocash, City Gross och Mathem.

title: Fullstack developer
description:
**Do you want to be a part of a dynamic software development team working with the latest technology?**
 Join Common Commercial Solutions (CCS) as a fullstack developer!
   

  

**THE TEAM:**
 Common Commercial Solutions (CCS) is a department consisting of 40 software engineers in addition to UX Designers, Product Managers and Data analysts with teams in Oslo, Stockholm and Kraków.
   

  

 The CCS team is a crucial part of Schibsted News Media and at its core focuses on building a world class subscription platform. Our User Revenue Suite is a modern subscription platform that will be used by all brands within Schibsted News Media. Our brands include the biggest news destinations in Norway and Sweden like Aftenposten, VG, Bergens Tidende, Aftonbladet, Svenska Dagbladet and many more.
   

  

 The User Revenue Suite handles all aspects of the customers journey from purchasing a subscription to Billing, Marketing Automation, Campaign Management, Data & Insight and Customer Service. The Marketing Automation team in Oslo and Stockholm which you will be part of focuses on building integrations and tools to support Sales- and CX-resources in their daily work. For that we create and maintain systems where the users can build Salesposter, Landingpages, Campaigns, Segments and AB-testing as well as ad hoc experiments.
   

  

**ABOUT THE ROLE**
 We are looking for a
 **Fullstack developer** 
 to grow our team.
   

  

 We have a modern tech stack which we refine and improve as we discover solutions for the situations we face. You will find yourself with the opportunity to work with JS/TS, Node, React, Next, Kotlin, micro-services, SQL & NoSQL databases, a wide range of AWS services, Convox, Kubernetes, Snowflake as well as experiment with new technologies.
   

  

 You will report to the team’s designated Engineering Manager and you will work closely with a highly skilled team of software engineers in CCS.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Contribute to engineering efforts from investigation, to design, to implementation; solving complex technical challenges along the way
* You will work together with Engineering Managers, UX Designers, Product and Engineering teammates to build new services and features
* Bring forward and develop ideas which are vital to the biggest news media sites across Norway and Sweden
* Collaborate across teams, functions, and companies within News Media to create the best possible product and user experience
* Coach others in your strengths, learn from your peers, and embrace complete ownership of our product


**What we are looking for in a Candidate:**
* A degree in software engineering or information systems (or other relevant education)
* Experience as a software developer from several projects in a professional working environment
* Strong skills in Javascript/Typescript and/or Java/Kotlin and experience working with cloud infrastructure
* A team player with a passion for problem solving
* Proficient in English and one Scandinavian Language


**We offer you:**
* Possibility to shape your own role and make an impact!
* Excellent opportunities for professional and personal development
* An organisation where employees support, trust and cheer for each other
* An organisation in constant development and leader of our industry
* Flexibility to work from the office and from home
* Competitive salary, good Insurance and pension schemes


**Please note that due to Summer vacations, our response will be delayed, and the process will kick off in Aug.**

title: Senior Backend Developer (.NET)
description:
MAJORITY is a groundbreaking all-in-one digital financial service app that includes an FDIC-insured account, Visa® Prepaid card, money remittance, and international calling. We are built for migrants, by migrants.
   

  

 Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are following their dreams, love or new experiences, more and more of us are leaning towards new environments. Our purpose at MAJORITY is to empower the amazing, the brave, and the talented and help them achieve all of their ambitions.
   

  

 We believe that everyone deserves the same opportunity to succeed. Our mission is to provide migrants the tools to thrive in their new country.
   

  

 We are a diverse group of people from over 40 different countries that come together every day and we’re looking for others driven by the same desire to create meaningful products that bridge cultural and geographic distances
   

  

 MAJORITY is looking for a Senior Backend Engineer (.NET) to join its Engineering team. This is a full time position based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**About MAJORITY Backend**
 We’re a diverse bunch of skilled software developers with a passion for technical excellence. We strive to create innovative solutions to the many varied business problems that we are presented with. We work hard, deliver fast, are continually learning and have fun along the way. With a team of 8-10 backend developers we have built a system of 50 microservices with a million lines of C# code. Our business is growing fast and therefore so is our need to continually scale the system to meet the growing number or users and transactions.
   

  

* We have a modern technical platform. Everything .Net6, currently upgrading to .Net8.
* We have a microservice architecture, fully in C#. built on a solid foundation of base functionality like observability, DI, messaging etc.
* We have a high pace of development, shipping major new features frequently.
* We have leadership who understands and prioritizes technical work.
* We work in a domain (fintech) where correctness matters. We have very high uptime and correctness requirements. No payments should fail, and no cent can be lost!


****Key Responsibilities****
* Design, develop and maintain microservices built with .NET Core
* Write clean code with proper test coverage to support CI/CD workflows
* Contribute in design and architecture decisions within the team and across the organization
* Develop scalable, performant, and reliable systems
* Participate as a team member in agile deliveries
* Identify bugs and bottlenecks and resolve issues efficiently


****Requirements****
* You have 10+ years of experience working with modern backend development practices, with focus on .NET Frameworks and C#.
* You have good experience in cloud environments
* You have good experience working with SQL databases
* You are familiar with working with microservices & event driven architecture
* You have an understanding and interest in building and maintaining microservices running in Kubernetes
* You have experience with build tools and services such as AzureDevops


****About you****
* You're smart and you get stuff done
* You are ambitious, have a positive energy and always find a solution
* You can prioritize speed without neglecting quality and understand that speed is a competitive advantage
* You have a strong sense of ownership and accountability
* You are eager to learn from others and share what you know
* You dare to make decisions and learn from your mistakes
* You can reason through the trade-offs to make correct decisions for the benefit of the organization
* You have great communication skills in English


 Looking to be challenged? To work in an environment where your opinions are welcome and you’re constantly learning? To have a real impact on a meaningful project? To work with the latest technologies and to help shape the technology direction of the organization? Then we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 We are MAJORITY. We are international, ambitious, kind, and inclusive. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Senior Software Developer to PerkinElmer
description:
When joining PerkinElmer, you select an experienced and trusted leader in scientific solutions, with the support of a global service network and distribution centers, providing the right solution, at the right time, to meet critical customer needs. With over an 80+ year legacy of advancing science and a mission of innovating for a healthier world, our dedicated team collaborates closely with commercial, government, academic and healthcare customers to deliver our broad portfolio of analytical solutions, and OneSource services.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Hybrid working – 3 days in Hägersten Office
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 According to agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 PerkinElmer in Stockholm is looking for a motivated, experienced senior software development engineer professional to accelerate our growth of our Perten instrumentation which tests quality and performance in the Food Industry. Perten Instruments, a part of PerkinElmer’s Food Solutions business, has a rich 60-year legacy of providing leading testing instrumentation to the food industry, including near-infrared, process NIR, and rheology solutions.
 


  


 As a Senior Back-end Engineer, you will play a critical role in developing and maintaining the cloud infrastructure and services that power the Food instrument. We think that you have prior experience in AWS C# .NET windows stack, CQRS, Event Sourcing, and DDD, as you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing scalable and resilient systems. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to architect solutions that leverage these principles to enhance our products' performance, reliability, and maintainability. This role requires a deep understanding of distributed systems, event-driven architectures, and domain modelling. Write clean, maintainable, and testable code, following industry best practices and coding standards. Participate in architectural discussions and contribute to the overall system design.
 


  


 Identify and address performance bottlenecks, security vulnerabilities, and other issues in the back-end infrastructure. Monitor and troubleshoot production systems to ensure their stability and availability. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to debug and troubleshoot issues in legacy code bases.
   




**Work tasks**
  
* Develop and maintain scalable, reliable, and high-performance backend systems using C#, .NET, IIS, SQL Server and AWS
  
* Understand and analyze legacy software systems to identify areas for improvement, updates, and modernization
  
* Collaborate with stakeholders, architects, and developers to devise strategies for upgrading and migrating legacy systems
  
* Develop and implement plans for refactoring, rewriting, or integrating new functionalities into existing software
  
* Perform maintenance tasks, bug fixes, and optimizations on legacy codebases
  
* Design and optimize databases and data models to efficiently store and retrieve large volumes of data
  
* Conduct thorough code reviews and provide constructive feedback to ensure high-quality codebase
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Bachelor/Master of Science in Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
  
* Proven work experience (5+ years) in software development using C# and .NET framework.
  
* Database: Microsoft SQL server
  
* Proficiency in designing and deploying applications on AWS cloud services (e.g., EC2, Load balancer, S3, Lambda)
  
* Strong knowledge of software architecture, design patterns, and best practices.
  
* Experience of working with Rest API and Microservices based architecture
  
* You have experience building micro services and can decompose large monoliths into highly scalable, distributed, smaller components that follow micro service paradigms.
  
* Proficiency in writing efficient and optimized SQL queries
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Hands on experience in implementing Software Design Patterns and Enterprise level Design patterns [ e.g. Pub-Sub, DDD, CQRS and event sourcing]
  
* Experience with DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and infrastructure as code tools is a plus
  
* Experience with modernization strategies, refactoring, and migration of legacy systems is a plus.
  
* Adaptability and willingness to work with diverse technologies and systems.
  
* You are comfortable with asynchronous programming, event driven architectures and writing decoupled applications.
  
* Drive continuous improvement by staying updated with emerging technologies and industry trends in AWS
  
* Background with database design, from crafting a schema from scratch, to writing efficient queries. Candidate should understand execution plans and how to utilize indexes
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 



 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.
   




**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Julia Fresk or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on julia.fresk@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105073

title: Senior Data Scientist I Candy Crush Soda
description:
**Craft:**
 Data, Analytics & Strategy
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We are looking for a Data scientist who will contribute to the discovery and experimentation cycles by understanding, modelling, predicting and segmenting the behavior of our players. The goal is to drive product innovation and enhance our product's competitive edge in the market by learning how to better engage and retain our players. At Candy Crush Soda, you will collaborate closely with game designers, developers, product analysts, and operators, and forge a strategic partnership with product managers.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

 Data analysis and opportunity discovery
   

  

* Lead problem discovery alongside the product manager, conducting exploratory analysis to uncover player problems and needs that are in line with the opportunities being explored by the product team.
* Model desired player behaviour, with focus on segmentation of users.
* Conduct thorough data analysis using statistical methods to identify trends, patterns, and insights related to product performance and user behaviour.
* Identify gaps and opportunities within the product and subsequently propose data-informed product changes or enhancements.
* Develop new analyses, experiments and data-driven tools to harness business opportunities and share them with King’s data science community.


 Experimentation
   

  

* Work closely with game designers and the product team to scope and design tests, translating business needs to technical and AB test requirements (including correct implementation and event tracking).
* Design, implement, and analyse A/B tests to evaluate the impact of changes to the product, features, or user experience, making recommendations based on test outcomes.
* Monitor the performance of experiments and provide insights to optimise product features.


 Documentation and knowledge sharing
   

  

* Communicate findings and recommendations clearly to stakeholders across Soda.
* Document analytical processes, findings, and recommendations, ensuring knowledge is shared and accessible within the team and Soda.
* Champion data literacy within the cross-functional game team.


 Desired requirements
   

  

* Hands-on experience with data science in a product context.
* Demonstrable ability to extract, manipulate, and interpret large datasets, identifying trends, and making data-driven recommendations. This includes understanding key performance indicators (KPIs) relevant to product success.
* Experience working with data using SQL and creating sophisticated queries.
* Practical experience with an analytical programming language such as R or Python for data manipulation.
* Strong understanding of statistical techniques such as hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and Bayesian data analysis.
* Adept in visualisation tools with experience in information visualisation and presentation.
* Ability to clearly articulate insights and recommendations to stakeholders, including those without a technical background. This includes excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.


 Bonus skills
   

  

* Previous game industry experience
* Previous experience working with Looker
* Experience in behavioural psychology/economics/game theory and experimental design
* Advanced machine learning
* Knowledge of user research and design thinking principles
* Experience with roadmap planning, understanding how data analysis informs the prioritisation of new features or enhancements to existing ones


**About King**
 At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Pega Lead / Senior System Architect - based in Poland
description:
The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its newly created Centre of Excellence 2 experts:
 **Pega Lead / Senior System Architect - Poland\*** 
 . These positions will be part of
 **Group Corporate Services Directorate – Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO) - Business Solutions Department (BSD) located in the EIB External Office in Warsaw.**
 These are full-time temporary positions at grades 5/6 in Warsaw, Poland. The term of these contracts will be 4 years.
   

  

* internal benchmark (Senior) Officer IT Applications


**Purpose**
 Are you ready to contribute to a sustainable future and be at the heart of the European Union's Climate Bank's digital evolution? The European Investment Bank (EIB) is on a strategic mission to integrate advanced IT technologies, enhancing our business efficacy and the interaction experience with our clients and partners. Our Digital Transformation's success is energized by the diverse array of our team's skills, profound expertise, and dedication to bringing our forward-thinking vision to life. While we’re headquartered in the vibrant city of Luxembourg, we’re excited to establish a Pega Centre of Excellence in the dynamic hub of Warsaw!
   

  

 Join us in this transformative journey to develop a unified Pega Platform. We've mapped out over 100 micro journeys—targeted, impactful customer interactions—that are pivotal to our roadmap in the coming years. We’re in search of exceptional Pega Lead / Senior System Architects who are not only adept at decoding business requirements but are also enthusiastic team collaborators, eager to take the initiative and lead by example.
   

  

 Your mission? To drive innovation and craft scalable, robust software solutions that elevate the user experience. Be a part of our team, advocate for and architect technical solutions that are in line with the finest IT practices.
   

  

 Are you up for the challenge? Let’s shape the digital future together. Apply now to build technological excellence with a purpose!
   

  

**Operating Network**
 As a pivotal member of one of our specialized teams, you will report directly to the Head of the Unit. You will work in close collaboration with the squad leaders and internal business customers. As you will be based in Warsaw some business travel to the EIB Headquarters in Luxembourg is foreseen. This dynamic role not only offers the opportunity to impact our digital landscape but also enables you to engage with diverse teams and projects across Europe.
   

  

**Accountabilities**
* Drive innovative technical solutions in alignment with business objectives, leveraging Pega technologies as a catalyst for digital transformation
* Lead the Pega solution lifecycle, upholding high standards in system design, development, and operations, and embedding best practices in IT strategy and execution
* Foster an environment that promotes Agile and DevOps methodologies, ensuring rapid and reliable delivery of business value
* Guide and inspire a culture of continuous improvement, staying ahead of the curve in Pega technology advancements and applying these insights to enhance the EIB Group's IT solutions
* Collaborate with diverse teams, contributing to strategic technology decisions and building cohesive, customer-centric Pega solutions
* Mentor and elevate junior talent, cultivating expertise and a shared vision for excellence
* Ensure robust performance management of Pega platforms, setting and exceeding key performance indicators to deliver outstanding results


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in computer science or related disciplines
* At least 5 years of relevant experience in delivering software solutions with the minimum of 2 years in Pega development
* Certified Pega Lead System Architect and/or Pega Senior System Architect recognition will be an advantage
* Hands-on experience in software development lifecycle
* Experience in taking technical design decisions
* Excellent knowledge of DevOps and Agile principles, methods and practices
* Experience in the banking, financing or insurance domain would be considered an advantage
* Experience in supervising a small team (1-5) of Pega Software Engineers would be considered an advantage
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*), with a good knowledge of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage


**Competencies**
*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

*(\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
**Additional Information**
 The remuneration of staff hired directly at a post in an external office within the EU may be adapted to the costs of living of the respective country. Please follow the link We invest in you.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunities employer, who believes that diversity is good for our people and our business. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 Applicants with specific needs are encouraged to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

**Deadline for applications:** 
 This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until the positions are filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

title: Senior IT-Drifttekniker med spetskompetens Active Directory
description:
**Din roll** 




 Axians i Stockholm utökar nu med ytterligare en erfaren IT-drifttekniker som har stark passion för Active Directory.
 



  





 I rollen som IT-drifttekniker kommer du att vara en del av ett team av tekniska förvaltare och arkitekter. Ditt ansvar kommer att inkludera utveckling, förvaltning och felsökning av produkter och tjänster inom vår sourcingleverans med huvudfokus på Microsofts Active Directory och närliggande produkter.
 



  





 Du kommer också att samarbeta med andra specialister inom Active Directory i ett virtuellt team för att bidra till varandras utveckling och Axians framsteg inom området.
 



  





**Kompetensprofil** 




 Vi söker dig med gedigna kunskaper inom Windows Server och Active Directory Services, Azure AD och det är meriterande om du har generell erfarenhet av molntjänster som Azure och Microsoft 365.
 



  





 Du är en ansvarstagande och driven individ som är engagerad och hungrig efter att vidareutvecklas inom IT-branschen och framförallt inom Active Directory. Du har förmågan att tänka utanför boxen och är lösningsorienterad i ditt arbetssätt.
 



  





 Krav:
 


* Djupgående kompetens inom Active Directory Services inklusive DNS, ADFS, NPS, PKI och certifikat
* Erfarenhet av arbete med Active Directory ur ett IT-säkerhetsperspektiv
* Erfarenhet av arbete med Windows Server OS i samtliga versioner
* Grundläggande kunskaper inom nätverksteknik
* Arbete enligt ITIL-standarder
* Färdigheter i Script och Powershell



  





 Meriterande:
 


* Erfarenhet av molntjänster, särskilt Azure och Microsoft 365
* Certifieringar inom Microsoft produkter
* Erfarenhet av automation och utvecklingsarbete



  





**Axians erbjuder**
